personalInfo.name: Bhargavi Govardhanam
personalInfo.title: Senior Full Stack & Frontend Architect
personalInfo.summary: I am a solution-focused Senior Frontend Engineer based in Dallas, TX, bridging the gap between engineering feasibility and user experience. My journey spans from building high-volume e-commerce platforms for Walmart to designing life-saving healthcare tools at UMass Dartmouth. Most recently, I launched DiaFriend, a not-for-profit diabetes management app featured in UMass News for its impact on the SouthCoast Portuguese community. Whether I'm architecting micro-frontends at Point B or developing predictive algorithms for my Master's thesis, my goal remains the same: building technology that works for people.

experience.description: Architected a core Angular 17 application with micro-frontends for senior living healthcare, reducing bundle sizes by 40% and implementing AI-powered caregiver matching using GPT-4.

Sole developer of the DiaFriend mobile app (Google Play Store) and revamped the university library portal using React 18 and GraphQL. Recognized for technical contributions to nursing research and community health.
Built secure fintech onboarding flows handling cross-border payments with React & TypeScript. Ensured compliance and data integrity for high-stakes financial transactions.
Delivered a Loan Origination module processing 10k+ daily transactions using Vue.js and Spring Boot. Owned the UI architecture for high-traffic processing systems.
Built HIPAA-compliant portals for AstraZeneca and high-volume e-commerce modules for Walmart, optimizing performance for millions of users.

education.degree: Master of Science - MS, Computer Science
education.description: Thesis on predictive algorithms. Developed tools for community health research.

certifications.name: Ultimate AWS Certified Solutions Architect Associate 2026
